Sentencas: The electrochemical activity and stability of the PBCO electrode are investigated under the annealing processes in an atmosphere containing CO2/H2O for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Performance Degradation of a Double-Perovskite PrBaCo2O5+δ Cathode Operating under a CO2/H2O-Containing Atmosphere

Sentencas: The electrochemical impedance spectrum results unequivocally confirm the significant deterioration in PBCO cathode performance upon annealing under ambient air conditions, particularly when exposed to CO2/H2O atmospheres.
Titulo: Performance Degradation of a Double-Perovskite PrBaCo2O5+δ Cathode Operating under a CO2/H2O-Containing Atmosphere

Sentencas: Microstructure and surface chemical state analyses reveal the segregation of BaO on the PBCO surface, and the formation of insulating BaCO3 degraded the electrochemical performance.
Titulo: Performance Degradation of a Double-Perovskite PrBaCo2O5+δ Cathode Operating under a CO2/H2O-Containing Atmosphere

Sentencas: CO2 and H2O exhibit a significant induced effect on the segregation of Ba in PBCO to the surfaces, thereby causing a rapid decline in electrode performance.
Titulo: Performance Degradation of a Double-Perovskite PrBaCo2O5+δ Cathode Operating under a CO2/H2O-Containing Atmosphere

Sentencas: Additionally, the analysis of volume relaxation reveals that the presence of oxygen in the electrode environment can also influence the deposition process occurring on the surface of the electrode.
Titulo: Performance Degradation of a Double-Perovskite PrBaCo2O5+δ Cathode Operating under a CO2/H2O-Containing Atmosphere

Sentencas: However, this phenomenon is not observed in N-2.
Titulo: Performance Degradation of a Double-Perovskite PrBaCo2O5+δ Cathode Operating under a CO2/H2O-Containing Atmosphere

Sentencas: This study emphasizes the impact of various gases present in the working atmosphere on surface-separated BaO, which consequently plays a pivotal role in the activity and long-term stability of PBCO electrodes.
Titulo: Performance Degradation of a Double-Perovskite PrBaCo2O5+δ Cathode Operating under a CO2/H2O-Containing Atmosphere
